itemDescription: Governor of the British Virgin Islands

wikipedia_page.main: Henry Anthony Camillo Howard (3 March 1913 – 15 October 1977) was a British journalist, military officer, and colonial leader in the Caribbean.

response: Henry Howard and Sir Stafford Howard, brothers of the first Baron, were both Members of Parliament. The first baron Esme Howard's sons included Henry Anthony Camillo Howard and Hubert Howard.

link_mentions.page: List of colonial governors of the British Virgin Islands
Esmé Howard, 1st Baron Howard of Penrith
response: * Hon. Henry Anthony Camillo Howard (1913–1977), who was a journalist, military officer, and colonial leader in the Caribbean.

link_mentions.page: List of colonial governors and administrators of Saint Christopher

response: Howard was born in Washington, D.C. on 23 December 1907.Burke's Peerage, Baronetage, etc., 107th ed., 2003 He was the third of five sons of the diplomat Sir Esmé William Howard, 1st Baron Howard of Penrith, by his wife Lady Isabella Giovanna Teresa Gioachina Giustiniani-Bandini. Among his brothers were Francis Howard, 2nd Baron Howard of Penrith and journalist Henry Anthony Camillo Howard. His father later served as His Majesty's Ambassador to the United States of America from 1924 to 1930.
* Lieutenant-Colonel The Honourable Henry Anthony Camillo Howard, Administrator, St. Kitts-Nevis-Anguilla.

link_mentions.page: List of governors of dependent territories in the 20th century

response: *Henry Anthony Camillo Howard (1913–1977), Governor of the British Virgin Islands from 1954 to 1956
